p: Oxalis pes-caprae (common name bermuda buttercup, Oxalidaceae) is a perennial herb (up to 40 cm) with bulbills. It was probably introduced for ornamental purposes. It grows in cultivated lands and bare places, especially on loamy soils. It does not stand the frost and low temperature that lead to dryness of the aerial parts. It is native to South Africa (Cape region) [ 9]. It is also invasive in Mediterranean Europe, Western USA, Asia, Australia, New Zealand and South Africa [ 18].
